Authors:
Mentewab Ayalew, India Nichols, Raven Hardy, Keithara
davis, Brittani Carlington, Deja heckard
Title:
Analysis of conserved motifs in the plant specific group of
ABC transporters homologous with AtWBC19.
Keywords: ABC transporter, motif, AtWBC19, ABCG19, CK2, eIF3f
Abstract:
Background.ABC transporters are a protein superfamily
found in a variety of species and usually function in the transport of
solutes across cell membranes. All ABC transporters contain both an
ATP-binding cassette (ABC) domain, responsible for the binding and
hydrolysis of ATP, and a transmembrane domain, determining solute
specificity. We investigated the evolutionary pattern of ABC
transporters similar to AtWBC19 (ABCG19), an ABC transporter known to
confer resistance to kanamycin in Arabidopsis thaliana.
